This game is yet another from the hit Half-Life. From surviving sectors and canals of endless enemies, let them be Zombies, new Combine, and other Creatures that we all fear. this is the best game ever

This game is fantastic. In my personal opinion, it is the greatest game of all time. There is simply so much good stuff in this game I can't fit it all into this review. The gunplay is fun, the puzzles are interesting, the music is fantastic for the scenarios that it plays in, sound design for everything is great, the facial animations are STILL some of the best I've ever seen, everything about this game is perfect in my eyes.

I have yet to encounter a single glitch in this game, which goes a long way considering I've played 93 hours total with 5 or 6 playthroughs.

 The story is good, characters are memorable, the voice acting is spot on, graphics (especially for 2004) are very nice, the list goes on. I know this isn't the most well organized review, but this game is SO DARN GOOD. If for whatever reason you haven't bought this game yet, do so right now. Any price. Do it. Right now. Stop reading this and BUY THE GAME ALREADY.

And while you're at it, buy Half Life 2: Episode 1 and Half Life 2: Episode 2 and play them in this order: Half Life 2, HL2: E1, HL2: E2. You will not regret your purchase if you like FPS games and/or action/adventure games.

I played Black Mesa, which is a fan recreation of the original Half-Life, because my friend spent our entire first hour at school telling me about how amazing Half-Life and Half-Life 2 were. I absolutely loved it, but it left me really wanting more. That's where Half-Life 2 come in. From the very start you never see Gordan Freeman, the character you play as, but you control him through the whole game. This adds so much to the immersion the game offers through its intuitive gameplay and engaging story. You'll be caught up in this amazing game for days, if your constant playing doesn't finish it before that.

Join billionaire playboy Gordon Ramsay on his quest to put barrels on seesaws and shoot things with a gun.

With the help of his probably-a-bit-young-for-him-I-mean-it's-legal-but-ehh sidekick Alex Kingston, Commissioner Gordon sets out to kill a well-spoken white man in a business suit because the other white man in a business suit said it was a good idea.

Half LIfe 2. The successor to one of the most influential and praised FPS games since the creation of the genre. It's one thing for a game to be this fun and immersive at the time of release, but this game still looks and plays incredibly today. It is, in my mind, the pinnacle of FPS gaming, and will stand the test of time for many, many years. Absolutely sublime from start to finish. Every facet of this game, from the gameplay to the graphics to the world design to the ever important story line are so masterfully sculpted that you could put them against any other game, past, present, or future, and it could still stand up to any of them. Many games excel at one aspect. This game excels at all of them. It's no small feat to make a sequel as engaging, fun, and unique as the original, but this one does it beautifully. You owe it to yourself to play this game. It is an experience that you will not forget.

Half-Life 2. A great followup to Half-Life. In this game, you play as Gordon Freeman through City 17, an urban area controlled by the Combine forces- a new force who have taken over the Earth. You'll meet some old friends, though, so don't worry! The headcrabs still make up for a great part of the game- and who could forget the crowbar? Meet the guy who offered you a beer twenty years ago and maybe make some new, unexpected friends in Half-Life 2!

Игра, которую ждали вообще все, кто хоть как-то увлекался компьютерными играми. Много чего происходило во время этого самого ожидания. Разнообразные слухи, многообещающие трейлеры и ролики, показывающие возможности движка, мне даже удалось купить диск с украденной до выхода версией, на котором по большей части ничего интересного не было.

Ее выход ознаменовался небольшой технической революцией. Движок Source задал высокую планку для всех последующих выходящих игр, всем остальным приходилось стараться выглядеть как минимум не хуже.

Сегодня, уже почти в 2014 году, мне было интересно пробежать знакомые уровни некогда легендарной игры (фанаты, простите, но я не когда не признаю вторую часть лучше оригинальной первой) хотя бы ради получения веселых ачивментов от Steam-а. Заслуженные 8 с половиной хедкрабов из 10 красных монтировок от меня продолжению странствий немого профессора теоретической физики в застенках совкового Сити-17. Хорошая антиутопия получилась.

This game. Yes, this game.

The Half-Life series in general has one of the best storylines of any games I've played. HL2 is enjoyable without having played HL1, though HL1 is also an amazing game too, and if you don't mind outdated graphics and want the full experience, play the first one. Also, you should probably read my HL1 review as it's also based on the HL series in general.

Anyways...

If you're one of those people that doesn't like FPS's and generally thinks that all they are about is blood and gore, no general gameplay or anything, then Half-Life may change your mind about that. Games like Call of Duty are bad examples of that, unfortunately they are also the most common examples.

Half-Life, in my opinion, is enjoyable even if you don't particularly like FPS's. It has amazing gameplay and story, and I showed it to my friend Pokaymon and he played through the entirety of Half-Life: Source (hl1 but directly ported to the Source engine) and loved it, even though he didn't like FPS's that much.
If you don't walk into it thinking about it in a biased way and expecting no gameplay or story, then you might not enjoy it. If you be openminded about it, then you may enjoy it a lot and become attached to the amazing characters and storyline.   


Half-Life 2 expands on the story and characters introduced in the first game by making them actual characters and not player models with filenames. All jokes aside, Half-Life 2 takes place 20 years after the end of the first Half-Life and the initial events of the Black Mesa resonance cascade and the portal storms. The Combine, who had invaded the Vortigaunt homeworld before they fled to the borderworld Xen, set their sights on Earth after witnessing the heroic actions of Doctor Gordon Freeman who saved Planet Earth from the Nihilanth and the other aliens from Xen. A war took place between Earth's military and the Combine forces that lasted a total of seven hours, giving it the name the 7-hour war. Doctor Eli Vance and his daughter Alyx started to live in their own secret lab called Black Mesa East with Doctor Judith Mossman, a completely new character not form Black Mesa. Doctor Kleiner also has his own lab, and together they are forming the Resistance, a group bearing the Greek letter Lambda, which means not only the letter L, but the scientific term Half-life, which is why it is in the logo for the game series.
The Vortigaunts, after being freed from the Nihilanth, now have joined forces with the Resistance, and when the G-Man awakens Gordon from stasis 20 years since the events of the Black Mesa incident, he learns about the Combine's enslavement of Earth and Administrator Dr. Wallace Breen working with them in the "safe" City 17. Gordon Freeman, the "one free man," quickly becomes the face of the Resistance as they begin to attempt to stop the Combine.

Gameplay is mostly smilar to the first game, although there is much more variety in scenery, as well as the first known implementation of Havok physics in Valve's Source engine, allowing new forms of gameplay.

I recommend this game to a lot of people, and if you've played the Portal series, it might interest you to know that Half-Life takes place in the same universe. In fact, Portal was originally a sidegame to the Half-Life series, but then it became very popular so they released Portal 2 with more storyline and turning it into its own parallel series.

I rate this game 10 out of 10. kbai
Not much is needed to be said other than everyone should have this game.

Such an amazing game that it comes up in any conversation about what the best game ever is. While no game is ever perfect Half-Life 2 did a damn good job at bringing the original Half-Life world to life and seriously never failed to impress me. This game is a spectacular blend of mystery, high-paced action and a dash of horror. The vehicles were exciting, fun and really usefull, the weapons were diverse and ammo wasn't something just handed to you by the bucket loads. The music was addicting and I felt invincible every time it played. The puzzles were creative and hard, but not so hard that it made you feel less immersed. You will never forget the voice of the G-man as you shoot through this world of hopeless victims and endless violence. You know that you are there to stop it and every time you kill a combine soldier you only feel more powerful and skillful as I reached closer and closer to an end to the suffering of countless individuals. This game will change your perpective on shooters of you think that all they are is mindless spamming. Half-Life 2 does what you're supposed to do with any shooter game: make it good. And there is nothing that makes you feel better than blasting a headcrab zombie in the face as you hear that satisfying shotgun boom. 10/10
